page.title: 08EMPLOYMENT IN DOBWALLS AREA
page.content: IN THE COUNTRY AREAS MOST PEOPLE ARE EMPLOYED IN AGRICULTURE.A VERY FEW ARE INVOLVED IN CRAFTS.MANY SUPPLEMENT THEIR INCOME WITH PUTTING UP TOURISTS IN THE SUMMER. IN THE VILLAGES THE RANGE OF EMPLOYMENT IS GREATER. SOME WORK IN AGRICULTURE,AND ITS RELATED SERVICE INDUSTRIES.OTHERS WORK IN TOURISM. MANY COMMUTE TO PLYMOUTH ESPECIALLY TO THE DOCKYARD. IN DOBWALLS MANY WHO HAVE RECENTLY MOVED IN ARE IN THE ROYAL NAVY OR MARINE CORPS.SINCE CHATHAM CLOSED SOME DOCKYARD WORKERS HAVE MOVED HERE FROM KENT. ONLY ONE GENERATION AGO, PEOPLE HERE WENT TO SCHOOL TOGETHER, AND WORKED TOGETHER ALL THEIR LIVES.THIS HAS NOW MOSTLY CHANGED.YOUTH AND OTHER UNEMPLOYMENT IS ABOVE THE NATIONAL AVERAGE. THE NEAREST JOB CENTRE AND BENEFIT OFFICE IS IN LISKEARD 3M AWAY.
